text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hassan presides over Ramadan religious sermon.
- German President Roman Herzog hails King Hassan for his actions to ensure stability in Morocco.
- Casablanca court will give verdict on Monday in the case of 27 students accused of disturbing public order.
- The water utility office to increase bills to fill deficit.
- Othmane Benjelloun, president of the Moroccan banks association, wants an interest rate cut to spur investment.
- Disturbances rocked three universities in Casablanca.
- King Hassan is one of the Middle East peace architects.
- Thirty-seven Moroccans charged over welfare fraud in France.
